result.execSummary:
The defendant Lynn M Pepper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Election Day Campaigning/Election Off., an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 12.03(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders total fines/costs to be paid in full within 90 days of sentencing. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment entered against the defendant.
Costs to be paid along with fines. Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

With Huber, all standard release conditions. 
Per Court on 4/25/2022 - Court grants transfer to Walworth County - NO ELECTRONIC MONITORING.

Per Court on 5/9/2022 - Court clarifies that Huber release may include elder care for the defendant's mother. Elder care release through Huber may include transporting her mother to medical appointments.

Per Court on 5/19/2022 - Per request of the defendant, the Huber sentence is to commence on 5/20/2022. Defendant is to report to the Huber facility by 6:00 PM on 5/20/2022.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lynn M Pepper

defendant.name: Pepper, Lynn M
defendant.address: N9023 Spring Brook Ln, Whitewater, WI 53190

records.addlTxt: Copy of:  Letter sent to the defendant, from State Public Defender's Office, defendant is not financially eligible for SPD Representation.
signed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on May 19th, 2022.

Letter from defendant requesting either day report, electronic monitoring, or an earlier report date to serve her sentence.
**Reviewed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on 5/19/2022 - The request for electronic monitoring is denied. Please amend the JOC to reflect that the Huber sentence is to commence on 5/20/2022, as requested by defendant.**

faxed letter from Lee Ann C. requesting the Court allow defendant to have GPS monitoring in order to care for mother.

05/19/22 - Court Reviewed - Please advise Ms. Carpenter that either the defendant or her attorney need to make these requests. The court cannot act on third party requests for sentence modifications. ep
fax from defendant's sister with attached proof of mother's medical conditions and need for daily assistance

Letter from defendant's sister to the Court inquiring about conditions of defendant's Huber sentence.

05/13/22 - Court Reviewed - Elder care release from through Huber may include transporting a parent to medical appointments. The Court did not authorize Electronic Monitoring in lieu of the work release jail sentence. ep
Letter from defendant's sister to the court regarding defendant's sentence.

Letter from Attorney Bucher to the Court requesting an amendment to the judgment of conviction.
**Reviewed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on 5/9/2022 - The judgment of conviction will be amended to reflect that Huber release may include elder care for the defendant's mother.**
Letter, signed anonymous, to the court regarding defendant's sentence.

Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Lynn M Pepper in court with attorney Paul E Bucher.  
Court To Address:  Defense Postconviction Motion for Reconsideration of the Sentence 

State objects to the Defense Motion - Arguments presented.
Defense presented arguments to the court.
Responses and replies presented.

Court Denies - Defense Motion for Reconsideration.
Reasons placed on the record.

Court will also grant transfer to Walworth County - Only with the assurance that Walworth County will not put her on Electronic Monitoring.
Court will extend the report date to:  05/27/22 by 6 pm. to the Waukesha County Huber Facility.
Amended JOC to be Prepared.
Motion hearing on April 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Reconsideration of Sentence.
**Reviewed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on 4/14/2022 - Please set for a hearing.**
Exhibit B for the Motion for Reconsideration.
Exhibit A to the Motion for Reconsideration.

Clerk's Response to the Defendant's Notice of Intent to Pursue Postconviction Relief.
Sent to Attorney Bucher, State Public Defender's Office and the Defendant.
Defendant's Notice of Intent To Pursue Postconviction Relief.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Resignation Letter
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

11:50 AM Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Lynn M Pepper in court with attorney Paul E Bucher. 
Case called for an intial appearance.
Defense acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives further reading and enters a not guilty plea.
Case is ready to proceed to plea and sentencing.
State gives sentencing recommendations to the court.
Court conducts a plea colloquy with the defendant.
Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to count 1.  
Court finds the defendant guilty of count 1.
Attorney Bucher makes a statement regarding sentencing.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.
	
Court orders the following:
	
30 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/Huber (all standard release conditions) 
 
Defendant to report to the Huber Facility by 6 pm. on:  April 28, 2022.

Fine:  $379.00
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid in 90 Days.
Alternate: 11  Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/Huber (all standard release conditions).
Initial appearance on March 18, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 011174,
Payable Number: 460581,
Receipt Number: 22R 011756,
Amount: $20.00
